title: The star power and scandal of French icon Brigitte Bardot | ABC NEWS
description: French icon Brigitte Bardot swiftly rose to fame in the 1950s as an era-defining sex symbol. The film icon brought French cinema to the mainstream, but would turn her back on acting later in life and court further controversy as an animal rights activist. Fans are paying tribute to Bardot after her death at the age of 91. title: Albanese stands firm as Bondi victims' families demand royal commission | ABC NEWS
description: Families with loved ones killed or injured in the Bondi Beach attack have penned an open letter to the prime minister, demanding a federal royal commission into the massacre. Anthony Albanese is refusing to budge, instead outlining the terms of a independent review which he argues will be quicker and more effective. title: Father builds son his dream castle home | ABC News
description: They say 'a man's home is his castle', and in south-west Victoria, that's become a reality.  A local builder has built his son a real-life castle, complete with a moat and drawbridge, and it's turning heads in their quiet Warrnambool street.   Olivia Sanders reports. title: Stranded passengers to be rescued after cruise ship ran aground off PNG | ABC NEWS
description: About 80 passengers on board the Coral Adventurer cruise ship will be flown back to Australia after efforts to refloat the vessel were unsuccessful. The cruise ship struck a coral reef off the coast of Papua New Guinea on Saturday morning. Deputy Prime Minister of Papua New Guinea John Rosso joined ABC News from Lae to discuss the incident. title: Re-Spin: Tony Armstrong puts himself on the line in the fight against racism
description: Tony Armstrong considers himself a cynical person, which is why it's a somewhat ironic that he's emerged from his latest project with renewed optimism. The former AFL player has spent the past year researching the scope of racism in sport and society and seeking to do something about it. He’s seen the failed anti-racism campaigns, the well meaning but toothless initiatives and Armstrong has had enough. Tony has travelled the globe to speak to influential athletes, tech pioneers and grass roots advocates to chart a way forward in an increasingly insidious space. Featured: Tony Armstrong, ex-AFL footballer and sports broadcaster.   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: US strikes 'implementation area' at Venezuela dock, Trump claims | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump says US forces have struck an area at a dock in Venezuela where he claims boats are loaded with drugs. The move would mark the latest escalation by Washington, as the Trump administration ramps up economic and military pressure on Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.  At least 100 people have been killed in US strikes on suspected drug vessels in the Caribbean and the Pacific in the US president’s so-called war on drugs. title: Ukraine rejects claims of drone attack on Putin’s residence | ABC NEWS
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denied claims Kyiv launched a barrage of drones at Vladimir Putin’s official residence near St Petersburg.  Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov says Moscow is reconsidering its position on negotiations to end the Ukraine war after the alleged attack on the Novgorod region.  It comes after the Ukrainian president left Mar-a-Lago on a high note after a meeting with US counterpart Donald Trump. Territorial disputes including the Donbas region remain a major sticking point in talks for a Russia-Ukraine truce. title: China simulates Taiwan blockade in response to massive US arms deal | ABC NEWS
description: China has launched one of its largest ever military drills around Taiwan, surrounding the island with army, naval, air force and rocket units. Beijing says it’s a direct response to a multi-billion dollar arms package recently approved for Taiwan by the US. title: Kimberley coast braces for Cyclone Hayley as Queensland floods | ABC NEWS
description: Tropical Cyclone Hayley has been upgraded to a category four system and residents living on Western Australia's Dampier Peninsula have been told to prepare for "severe impacts" when the system makes landfall tonight. Meanwhile, heavy storms are expected to continue in parts of Queensland with floodwaters not expected to recede for at least another few days. title: Trump threatens Hamas, Iran after Netanyahu meeting in Florida | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has issued stern warnings to Hamas and Iran after his meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida.  The US leader says Hamas will have ‘hell to pay’ if they fail to disarm as part of a peace plan for Gaza, while suggesting the US might strike Iran again if Israeli intelligence reports of Tehran rebuilding its missile program are true.  The US leader insists a nuclear-free Iran is required for peace in the Middle East. title: Six IS militants and three police officers killed after siege in Türkiye | ABC NEWS

Turkish authorities say all six militants were Turkish citizens. It comes amid Türkiye’s national crackdown on terrorism. title: Menorah to light up Harbour Bridge after Jewish creatives say dove symbol  'insufficient' | ABC NEWS
description: A menorah will light up the Sydney Harbour Bridge on New Year's Eve after an open letter signed by Jewish creatives deemed the plan for a dove of peace was 'insufficient' and 'obfuscates and erases the problem of antisemtisim'. The City of Sydney had initially planned to illuminate the bridge with an image of a dove and the word "peace" to commemorate the 15 people killed in the Bondi shootings on December 14.
